content.title: TEVAR with Arch Debranching
content.definition: Hybrid approach combining open surgical revascularization of aortic arch branch vessels with thoracic endovascular aortic repair (TEVAR) to extend proximal landing zones.

key_concepts.description: Zone 0: Ascending aorta. Zone 1: Between innominate and left carotid. Zone 2: Between left carotid and left subclavian. Zone 3: Distal to left subclavian. Zone 4: Descending thoracic aorta.
Surgical bypass of arch vessels to allow endograft coverage of native origins, extending the proximal seal zone.
Debranching may be staged (separate procedure) or simultaneous with TEVAR.

carotid_subclavian_transposition.description: Move left subclavian origin to side of left carotid

carotid_subclavian_bypass.description: Prosthetic graft from left carotid to subclavian

zone_2_landing.vertebral_considerations: Dominant left vertebral or prior LIMA graft requires revascularization

zone_1_landing.requirement: Revascularization of left carotid and left subclavian

options.double_bypass: Right carotid to left carotid, left carotid to left subclavian
options.single_graft_bifurcated: Bifurcated graft from ascending aorta or right side

zone_1_landing.approach: Cervical incisions, potentially with partial sternotomy for proximal anastomosis

zone_0_landing.requirement: Total arch debranching - all three arch vessels

options.ascending_aortic_graft: Require median sternotomy, graft from ascending aorta to all arch branches
options.complexity: Approaches open arch replacement in complexity

zone_0_landing.alternative: May consider total arch replacement or branched/fenestrated endograft instead

simultaneous.description: Debranching and TEVAR in single setting
simultaneous.disadvantages: Longer procedure, bleeding risk with anticoagulation

staged.description: Debranching first, TEVAR days to weeks later
staged.advantages: Assess bypass patency before committing to coverage

complications.endoleak: Type Ia if inadequate landing zone

outcomes.mid_term_survival: Comparable to open repair in high-risk patients

content.statement: TEVAR with Arch Debranching is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Hybrid-Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding TEVAR with Arch Debranching helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of TEVAR with Arch Debranching include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of TEVAR with Arch Debranching.

learning_objectives: Define aortic landing zones and requirements for each
Describe debranching options for zones 0, 1, and 2
clinical_pearls: Transposition has better long-term patency than bypass
Check for dominant left vertebral before covering left subclavian
Zone 0 debranching approaches complexity of open arch repair

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). TEVAR with Arch Debranching. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
